customer_name: Stevie Stoltzfus Abram Stoltzfus Bertha Stoltzfus

citations.narrative:
A litter of ten Great Dane puppies, approximately 5 weeks old, did not have identification. Other puppies in the kennel
were identified with a cage card attached to their enclosure, but none was present for the Great Danes. Nor were any
previous cage cards saved. It is difficult to trace individuals in the event of a disease outbreak without identification. Live
puppies, less than 16 weeks of age, shall be identified by one of the acceptable methods, including cage cards.
Correct by: July 14, 2025

The written program of veterinary (PVC) care is incomplete. The portion of the PVC available for inspection today
referenced another document, which provided more detailed treatment descriptions. This document could not be found. It
is difficult to follow the PVC without all the necessary information, therefore animal health may be at risk. The complete
written program of veterinary care must be kept, maintained, and made available for APHIS inspection.
Correct by: July 14, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Alexandra Calderon, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.50(a)(2) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
A litter of ten Great Dane puppies, approximately 5 weeks old, did not have identification. Other puppies in the kennel 
were identified with a cage card attached to their enclosure, but none was present for the Great Danes. Nor were any 
previous cage cards saved. It is difficult to trace individuals in the event of a disease outbreak without identification. Live 
puppies, less than 16 weeks of age, shall be identified by one of the acceptable methods, including cage cards. 
 
Correct by: July 14, 2025 
3.13 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The written program of veterinary (PVC) care is incomplete. The portion of the PVC available for inspection today 
referenced another document, which provided more detailed treatment descriptions. This document could not be found. It 
is difficult to follow the PVC without all the necessary information, therefore animal health may be at risk. The complete 
written program of veterinary care must be kept, maintained, and made available for APHIS inspection. 
 
Correct by: July 14, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
